docs.lead_paragraph: The House of Representatives today passed a bill that would permit general health claims for vitamins and dietary supplements. [ The Senate passed the measure early on Saturday and sent it to President Clinton, who is expected to sign it. ] The bill, which covers the products' labels and advertising, ends a two-year dispute over vitamin labeling that has pitted the Food and Drug Administration against industry lobbyists.

headline.main: Bill Allowing Vitamin Claims Wins Approval
